data.title: Hipster coffee in North Dakota
data.text: Yup. Felt just like Portland, San Francisco, Seattle...real coffee made the way you want it. Everyone patiently waiting their turn. Mellow atmosphere with good music. Clever eats. Caring baristas. Take your time, Treat yourself.

data.title: Cute shop, good coffee, yuppie atmosphere.
data.text: This shop is very well decorated.   The coffee was fantastic.  My only complaint (If you could call it one) is that the guy taking your order insists on personally introducing himself to each and every customer.   I found this to be slightly weird and uncomfortable.   Other than that, I recommend hanging out here for a coffee and a chat, if you're in the neighborhood.

data.title: Always great coffee and service
data.text: Everyone there is always so friendly and I love that! Their coffee is some of the best in town and their scones are to die for!

data.title: Love it!
data.text: What a great find in downtown Fargo.  This coffee shop has such a warm, welcoming vibe.  The 2 gentleman working the day we visited were so friendly and helpful.   The menu/offerings are unique and not what you find at your Caribou or Starbucks. Fargo is lucky to have this one of a kind coffee shop.

data.title: The coffee shop I've been looking for.
data.text: After moving from Portland, Oregon several years ago, I longed for a coffee house experience like this, but my attempts to find the right place kept coming up short. I recently discovered Twenty Below, which has apparently been open for over a year now. I have been there twice, and my spouse has been many times. Their service is predictably warm and personal, and they give an honest effort to learning each customer's name. Their coffee selection is impressive, and it's particularly attractive that you can choose your own brewing method from many. Guidance is provided as needed. They also have a small variety of waffles, scones, cookies, and sweet breads. I tried the peach thyme waffle, with honey and goat cheese. It was hearty and delicious. The atmosphere is very modern and hip (e.g. shelves made from wood planks and metal pipes), and books and board games are offered for customers to use. During the day, many folks bring work to do and are welcome to stay for long periods of time. Please note that the hours are limited, so those wanting to grab a coffee on the way to work may find they are not yet open.

data.title: Amazing Selections and Great Service
data.text: I am not a coffee aficionado, but I was very impressed by all their selections, many of which were fair trade. It's a welcoming environment with great service. It was a little noisy when I was there (about 10:00 am) and I had trouble hearing my soft-voiced colleague at times, but that was the only downside.l

data.title: Great experience, fun atmosphere, locally minded!
data.text:
20 Below is one of the best coffee shops in the Fargo area! Locally owned, locally oriented with a fantastic emphasis on quality and atmosphere! The employees are fun and very engaging! The coffee is all locally roasted and ground, Blizzard of '66 is their signature blend. For those from the Fargo area, you will remember the Blizzard of 1966!
They also have goodies and snacks made in house with chocolate roasted and produced by their own chocolatier!
You have to try it!!! Well worth the effort!!

data.title: Great Downtown Coffeeshop
data.text:
Twenty Below is where coffee meets community. They have stellar coffee, great waffles, and a great space downtown Fargo. Big fan of the Blizzard of '66 roast. 

However, if you're looking for that quiet reflective coffee shop, this may not be the place. I can't walk in and zone out, because I get to see all of my friends. This place is just teeming with good energy, whether you like it or not!

data.title: Off Broadway - Great Coffee Shop
data.text: Twenty Below is just off Broadway and is great, and fun new coffee shop. Wonderful coffee options (I had the butterscotch latte) and fresh baked goods. At times it's hard to find a parking spot, but I just drove around the block and then I scored s spot - but so worth it!

data.title: Cool Quirky Coffee Shop
data.text:
The past month I have been frequenting 20 Below quite a bit and I have to say they make some great coffee and are always extremely friendly. I would put it on anybody's "must-go to" list when visiting Fargo. 

It can get a little drafty in there if you sit near the back and the door is open and it takes a but to get your coffee so I wouldn't recommend it if you are truly pressed for time, but these are small considerations given how cool the atmosphere is and the drinks.

data.title: Delicious coffee, friendly atmosphere
data.text:
There are many coffee experiences in the Fargo/Moorhead area, but this one is easily my favorite. In just a few short months, it has made its own unique mark on the city with nontraditional offerings, carefully-sourced ingredients, and an ability to make you feel like you're part of the family even as a first-time visitor.

One of its unique draws is the variety of methods they use for brewing, which ensures that even the die-hard black coffee drinker gets a chance to try something new. I thought I had seen every possible way of achieving a cup of coffee, but there were several methods I had never tried (let alone even heard of) that have now become staples in my own home. They also roast all their own beans, and usually offer at least 3-4 varieties to choose from for your order, or bags to bring home to grind and enjoy yourself.

If doctored-up drinks are more your thing, you'll probably find your new favorite here as well, with unique offerings like a maple cinnamon latte, honey miel latte, and a variety of great teas served both hot or iced. The baked goods are made with love and carefully considered ingredients, usually taking into account dietary needs and using organic/locally-sourced items wherever possible. All the mugs, plates, etc. are handmade by a local ceramicist who has done a fantastic job in crafting objects that are lightweight, beautiful, and perfectly fitted to the cozy atmosphere.

Speaking of atmosphere, this is an area where 20 Below absolutely shines. By your second or third visit, this will become the place "where everybody knows your name," usually because they've taken the initiative and extra effort to talk to you and get to know you personally. I love bringing my work to a coffee shop, and this is the one where I consistently feel welcomed, at ease, and productive. They do everything they can to encourage this atmosphere, with a community lunch hour, bring-a-friend BOGO day, and open game nights. They also do a fantastic job of showcasing local artists, choosing a new one to feature in the shop's walls every so often, as well as hosting occasional "meet the artist" events.

Seriously, make it a point to visit this F/M gem! You'll be glad you did.
